EXIT   X

THE RISK OF MONEY LAUNDERING

Page

Table of Contents

 

Do you remember the scenario?

 

Click here for a reminder

 

 

What could ABC Bank do to further investigate the nature of its relationship with Robert?

Scenario

Robert Howard comes into ABC Bank and wants to deposit $25,000 into his account. He has been a customer of ABC Bank for 25 years and has always been classified as low-risk.

 

However, recent transaction monitoring by ABC Bank has revealed large amounts of money being withdrawn out of his account. Some of the money has been transferred to low- interest accounts and then withdrawn to be used. These withdrawals are unusual for Robert's account, which has had little activity for 25 years.

 

Information gathered by ABC Bank about Robert show that he owns two restaurants, a nightclub and a carwash. However, ABC Bank does not have any other information about Robert on its databases.

Nothing, as Robert has been a customer for a long period of time

Collect more information in order to mitigate the risk of money laundering

ABC Bank has already collected enough information regarding Robert's investments

 
 
 

That is incorrect

 

It does not matter whether Robert is a long-time customer. ABC Bank should further investigate the nature of its relationship with Robert by collecting more information. Some examples of information that could be gathered include:

 

•         the expected source and origin of the funds to be used

•         copies of recent and current financial statements

•         the nature and purpose of relationships between signatories and beneficial owners

•         the anticipated level and nature of the activity that is to be undertaken through the relationship

That is correct!

 

ABC Bank should further investigate the nature of its relationship with Robert by collecting more information. Some examples of information that could be gathered include:

 

•         the expected source and origin of the funds to be used

•         copies of recent and current financial statements

•         the nature and purpose of relationships between signatories and beneficial owners

•         the anticipated level and nature of the activity that is to be undertaken through the relationship

That is incorrect
